text:
Today we're going to learn lots of
vocabulary and phrasal verbs with

Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow,
most famously known as Rachel and Phoebe
from Friends.

Do you want to understand natives even
when we speak fast?

Without getting lost, without missing the
jokes and without subtitles?

Then you better hit that Subscribe
button and the Bell down below, so that

you don't miss a single one of our new
lessons.

Just like this fan who says that he's
learned more in one of our lessons
than in 14 years learning school English.

So here at Learn English With TV Series
we are celebrating

3 Million subscribers! Thanks to you we
have been able to help

learners all around the world to learn
real life English

in a meaningful and fun way.
So to thank you

we are giving a 51% discount on our
Fluent with Friends course.

Just imagine, this time next
year you could be watching your favorite
TV series, laughing along with all the jokes.

You could be having a meaningful
conversation,

you might even get a promotion at work,
and you could even move to another country.
The possibilities are endless when you

put your mind to it,
and our Fluent with Friends course

can really help you to achieve your goals.
Just like Myriam, who says that by the

last lesson with our support she had
already achieved her goals

and each week she really looked forward
to the next lesson.

So what are you waiting for? You can
click up here or in the description down below,
To learn more and sign up now, and to get

your 51% discount you can use
the coupon code 3million

Amazing work today! So if you're ready to
take your English to the next level and

understand your favorite movies and TV
series,

then I highly recommend you take
advantage and check out

our Fluent with Friends course
for a huge discount with our 3million

code at checkout for your 51%
off. You can click down in the

description below for that link,
and remember you only have a few more

days to take advantage of this amazing

So now it's time to go beyond the
classroom and live your English.
Aww yeah!
